awardEventDetails.for: Most successful book series based on a film series
awardEventDetails.description: George Lucas (Lucas Licensing has recorded more than 100 million sales of Star Wars related books, with over 850 novelizations, original novels, reference books, children's books and role-playing supplements, including 80 New York Times best-sellers. The first original novel based on Star Wars characters was Splinter of the Mind's Eye (1978), written by Alan Dean Foster (USA).)

awardEventDetails.for: Highest box-office gross for a screenwriter

awardEventDetails.for: Highest box office film gross average for a director (male)

awardEventDetails.title: 2012 Winner Guinness World Record
awardEventDetails.for: Most prolific videogame series based on a licensed property
awardEventDetails.description: George Lucas (As of April 2012, a total of 279 Star Wars videogames had been released across 41 different platforms.)

awardEventDetails.title: 2011 Winner Guinness World Record
awardEventDetails.for: Largest fortune made from a film franchise

The Webby Awards

Guinness World Record Award

2016 Winner Guinness World Record
Most successful book series based on a film series
George Lucas (Lucas Licensing has recorded more than 100 million sales of Star Wars related books, with over 850 novelizations, original novels, reference books, children's books and role-playing supplements, including 80 New York Times best-sellers. The first original novel based on Star Wars characters was Splinter of the Mind's Eye (1978), written by Alan Dean Foster (USA).)

Highest box-office gross for a screenwriter
George Lucas

Highest box office film gross average for a director (male)
George Lucas

Most prolific videogame series based on a licensed property
George Lucas (As of April 2012, a total of 279 Star Wars videogames had been released across 41 different platforms.)
2011 Winner Guinness World Record
Largest fortune made from a film franchise
George Lucas
